mechanical engineering.

a mechanical engineer.
a building or buildings in which things are manufactured using machines; manufacturing plant; a factory.

a writing or engraving on a thin plate of copper mystical syllables, to be used as a talisman to keep away evil.

of little or no value, importance or worth; fit to be neglected or ignored.

the letter 'ಯ' (usu. pronounced with the vowel 'ಅ').
the largest glandular organ in vertebrate animals, located in the upper rightside of the abdominal cavity, which secretes bile; the liver.
a class of Hindu, jaina or buddhist demi-gods.
Kubēra, the head of this class.
an evil spiit; a devil; a goblin.
a kind of fragrant substance made by mixing camphor, musk, etc., used to smear on the body.

annoyance, harm, trouble caused by an evil spirit.

a festival of lights, observed during Kārtika, the eighth month in Hindu lunar calendar (approx. coinciding with November); diwali.
the world of Kubēra, the Regent of Wealth.

a class of women, as classified in Indian erotics, characterised by excess inclination towards sensual enjoyments.

a wife of a demi-god of this class.
a wife of Kubēra, the chief of this class.
a woman skilled in black-magic and supposedly having supernatural power by a compact with the devil or evil spirits; a witch.

name of an attendent of Durgā.
a female devil or goblin.
the power or practices of witches; black magic; sorcery; witchcraft.
the art or performing skill of producing baffling effects or illusions by sleight of hand, concealed apparatus, etc.; magic.

a man skilled in magic; a magician.
an infectious disease, caused by the organism Mycobacterium tuberculosis, that affects the lungs, and characterised by abnormal hard nodule or swelling; tuberculosis of the lungs.

the act of worshipping a deity.

a man who is eligible for worshipping a deity.
